subject: 205p 6/22 Update: Atlantis diverted to California; landing on tap at 3:50 p.m. EDT
body:
205p 6/22 Update: Atlantis diverted to California; landing on tap at 3:50 p.m. EDT



=================================

CBS NEWS STS-117 STATUS REPORT: 92
Posted: 1:54 PM, 6/22/07

By William Harwood
CBS News Space Analyst

EChanges and additions:

   SR-89 (06/22/07): Astronauts gear up for entry
   SR-90 (06/22/07): Updated weather forecast
   SR-91 (06/22/07): NASA waves off first Florida landing attempt
   SR-92 (06/22/07): Atlantis diverted to California; landing on tap at 3:50 p.m. EDT

=================================

1:54 PM, 6/22/07, Update: Atlantis diverted to California landing due to unstable weather in Florida

Faced with unstable weather at the Kennedy Space Center, entry Flight Director Norm Knight has decided to divert the shuttle Atlantis to a landing at Edwards Air Force Base, Calif., to wrap up an extended space station assembly mission.

Flying upside down and backward over the central Indian Ocean just south of the equator, commander Rick Sturckow and pilot Lee Archambault plan to fire Atlantis' twin braking rockets at 2:43:47 p.m. EDT for two minutes and 36 seconds, slowing the shuttle by about 200 mph and setting up a landing around 3:50 p.m. on runway 22 at Edwards.

The weather at Edwards appears ideal, with light and variable winds and no clouds to speak of. Knight decided to divert Atlantis to California today based on conditions in Florida and predicted bad weather Saturday at all three of NASA's shuttle landing sites.
